items.title: Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr — known for bleak, existential movies — has died
items.description: Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.

items.title: Edith Renfrow Smith, pioneer and witness to history, dies at 111
items.description: Last year, for Black History Month, NPR's Scott Simon spoke with Edith Renfrow Smith of Chicago, who has died at 111 years old.

items.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's puzzling political transformation, explained
items.description: Once a fierce advocate for Trump and his MAGA base, Greene has broken with the president and resigned from Congress. New Yorker writer Charles Bethea ...

items.title: Attempting to predict the economy in 2026
items.description: Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.

items.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
items.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine reco...
